data.title: AS Script Internal pointer getting auto deleted when no SharedPtrs point to it.
data.body:
I've found a rather strange behaviour, which I think is a bug, while using the ResourceCache class.

To give some background, I have a class ScriptManager that loads a bunch of script files and stores them on a std::map<string, ScriptFile*>. The script files get correctly loaded and compiled. Right after loading them (in the same method) I can call methods on them just fine.

The issue comes when in another function (from another class) I retrieve the ScriptFile pointer and try to call some methods on it with Execute(). I get a segfault.

After investigating a bit further I've found out that the internal ScriptModule pointer for the ScriptFile (retrieved with GetScriptModule() ). Points to a valid address before storing it to the hash table and points to null (memory address 0x0) after further retrieving it in another class. Note that the ScriptFile pointer itself still points to valid memory as I'm able to call the GetScriptModule() or Execute() methods.

I've found a workaround by storing SharedPtr instead of raw pointers in the hash table, or simply storing a SharedPtr to it somewhere else for that matter. 

If ResourceCache is returning a raw pointer I don't expect any SmartPointer magic happening on the background and I think this is a bug because of that. 

If that's the intended behaviour, or need any additional feedback, I'd appreciate if you could answer me back.

Thank you!

data.title: "No Octree" when reloading a 2D scene
data.body:
When saving a scene and loading it back (in application using F7 or in the Editor), "No Octree component in scene..." error is sent.
Simple lua script to replicate:

``` lua
require "LuaScripts/Utilities/Sample"

function Start()
    SampleStart()
    CreateScene()
    SubscribeToEvent("Update", "HandleUpdate")
end

function CreateScene()
    scene_ = Scene()
    scene_:CreateComponent("Octree")

    -- Camera
    cameraNode = Node() -- scene_:CreateChild("Camera")
    cameraNode.position = Vector3(9.0, 4.0, -10.0)
    local camera = cameraNode:CreateComponent("Camera")
    camera.orthographic = true
    camera.orthoSize = graphics.height * PIXEL_SIZE
    renderer:SetViewport(0,  Viewport:new(scene_, camera))

    -- Get tmx file
    local tmxFile = cache:GetResource("TmxFile2D", "Urho2D/isometric_grass_and_water.tmx")
    if tmxFile == nil then return end

    local tileMapNode = scene_:CreateChild("TileMap")
    local tileMap = tileMapNode:CreateComponent("TileMap2D")
    tileMap.tmxFile = tmxFile
end

function HandleUpdate(eventType, eventData)
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_F5) then
        scene_:SaveXML(fileSystem:GetProgramDir().."Data/Scenes/TileMap.xml")
    end
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_F7) then
        scene_:LoadXML(fileSystem:GetProgramDir().."Data/Scenes/TileMap.xml")
    end
end
```

data.title: Blender-Exported Animations Fail
data.body: Using the Urho3D-Blender exporter script and Blender 2.72 allows for models to be exported without a problem, but animations do not play. Observing the file size of *.ani files and adding debug-print behavior to the exporter indicates that data is being exported, but the final animations do not play either in the application or in the Urho3D editor when "test" is hit. The model simply stays in its neutral pose.

data.title: Bug, two PhysicsWorld components in scene.
Question about per-vertex light processing in GetBasePatches
Make Urho2D more faster
ScriptObject can be stored in Variant.
LOD system based on screen space percentage usage instead of distance
data.body:
LOD based on distance is difficult to judge for different object sizes, a system which uses screen space percentage (pre z-pass) allows better flexibility for drawables of varying sizes.

Caveat has to be that there is little to no performance impact or that it is treated as a separate component similar to the Unity LODGroup (http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/class-LODGroup.html). Additional benefit could be introduced if we allow culling of the item based on this percentage.

data.title: Build system refactoring
data.body:
This issue will be used to track the build system refactoring process. The issue description here will be kept updated to reflect what have been done and what are planned to do next, so far. You are welcome to comment to add or reject the planned items. Only items that made into the list below counts.
# Succeeded
- Shell scripts and batch jobs require external user input to determine the build tree location, similar to cmake-gui.
- Collapse the project logical structure so that the repo root is the CMake's source tree. The build tree location is totally user defined and not being assumed. The project physical structure will be kept as it is.
- Add another engine parameter to set the location of the asset directory (which contains the CoreData and Data subdirs).
- Re-explore new approaches to configure native tool building while configuring for cross-compiling LuaJIT library build so that both native and cross-compiling targets can be built in one build process.
- Creating an SDK-like include directory structure.
- Remove the existing abstraction that makes headers appear to be flatten. The implementation file will now include the header file from its corresponding physical sub-directory where it belongs to. The header file will now use a relative pathspec to include other header files.
# Failed

nil
# Planned

nil

data.title: [Editor] Bit mask selector
data.body:
Follows from this request thread: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic518.html

Adds an easier method to edit the bit masks in the editor.

data.title: Attribute animation on certain attributes doe not take effect as expected
data.body: Certain attributes such as Text's text require ApplyAttribute() to be called to actually applying the attribute value changes to the affected instance.

data.title: Endless loop in Log::HandleEndFrame
BillboardSet facing with multiple cameras
data.body: Due to view update happening separate from rendering, BillboardSet does not show correct camera-relative orientation when rendered from several cameras during a frame.
